qas.question: Aboriginal rights allow First Nations people to harvest wildlife for:
In BC hunting laws may apply differently to First Nations due to recognition of Aboriginal rights
Indigenous governments may make their own laws related to hunting that apply to their community members
First Nations people who are residents of BC and meet the definition of Indian under the Indian Act (Canada) are required to obtain a hunting license ender the Wildlife Act if they want to hunt.
Most areas in BC are the traditional territory or treaty lands of one or several Indigenous Nations.
